greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways to write 2*n as p + 2^k + 3^m, where p is a prime, and k and m are nonnegative integers.
comment: Conjecture: a(n) > 0 for all n > 1. In other words, any even number greater than 2 can be written as the sum of a prime, a power of 2 and a power of 3.
It has been verified that a(n) > 0 for all n = 2..3*10^9.
link: Zhi-Wei Sun, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Zhi-Wei Sun, Mixed sums of primes and other terms, in: Additive Number Theory (edited by D. Chudnovsky and G. Chudnovsky), pp. 341-353, Springer, New York, 2010.

Zhi-Wei Sun, Conjectures on representations involving primes, in: M. Nathanson (ed.), Combinatorial and Additive Number Theory II, Springer Proc. in Math. & Stat., Vol. 220, Springer, Cham, 2017, pp. 279-310. (See also arXiv:1211.1588 [math.NT], 2012-2017.)
results.author: _Zhi-Wei Sun_, Apr 29 2018
